tags.name: üü¢ First Steps > ‚úÖ 1. Register in 99minutos
tags.description:
1.  Create an account in the sandbox website: [URL Self Service](https://delivery-git-sandbox-99minutos.vercel.app/)
2.  Validate the account to the email received
3.  Go to Developers section
4.  On API Keys V3 section click on `Generar`
5.  After this the `client_id` and `client_secret` will be displayed
    

Use the credentials to generate access tokens as shown in the [documentation](https://developers.99minutos.com/reference/oauth_token_create) in the section `create access token`

Follow the same process in **production**.

## Environments

| **Environment** | **Website** | **API url** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Sandbox | <https://selfsandbox.99minutos.com> | <https://sandbox.99minutos.com> |
| Production | <https://envios.99minutos.com> | <https://delivery.99minutos.com> |

`Each environment has an independent set of credentials`

tags.name: üü¢ First Steps > ‚úÖ 2. Request access to fulfillment
tags.description:
AFTER having your clarification call and the **Fulfill99** service proposal signed, you will receive the documentation.

When you finish reading it, you have to send an email with the following characteristics:

Subject: **Fulfill99 integration - ‚Äúbrand name‚Äù**

Addressed to the following email:<newsellersfulfillment@99minutos.com>

In the email‚Äôs body, you will add the email addresses of all people who will be added to the slack group to follow up with the integration.
Once this process is done you can continue with the sandbox integration 

`Note: if your sandbox tests are successful and you are ready for production, you can contact the previously provided emails and request access to production`

sku.description: Enter the sku of the product, if it is not provided one will be generated automatically, **`it is important that it is stored, the operations of orders and arrival orders require it`**

patch.description: "You must enter at least one field to generate the request"

value.message: Product with sku test-sku not found

active.description: Allows you to activate/deactivate a product, preventing sales if that is deactivated

post.description: Allows you to massively insert the products

sku.description: Enter the sku of the product, if it is not provided one will be generated automatically, **it is important that it is stored, the operations of orders and arrival orders require it**

post.description:
This method provides an **xlsx file** with the following columns:

### Columns

*   thumbnail
*   sku
*   barcode
*   name
*   value
*   price
*   weight
*   height
*   width
*   length
    

each individual product must respect the rules previously seen, see [Field rules](#6e06a545-25eb-4d74-9f30-ac1fa43c21a9)
Allows you to massively insert the products via csv/xlsx

get.description:
The following fields return in the responseBody the possible values by which the search can be filtered.

In case you want to clean the search, they should not be sent in the request.

### FIELDS

**search** 
    * It is used when you want to find a text within the values of the fields: "orders.aoNumber".

**filters[inventoryStatus][]**
    *   It is used when you want to find a specific state in the field "orders.products.inventoryStatus".
    *   Example: not_received
    
**filters[status][]**
    *   It is used when you want to find a specific state in the field "orders.status".
    *   Example: pending

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: It is used when you want to find a text within the values of the fields: "orders.aoNumber".

parameters.name: filters[inventoryStatus][]
parameters.description: It is used when you want to find a specific state in the field "orders.products.inventoryStatus". Example: not_received

parameters.name: filters[status][]
parameters.description: It is used when you want to find a specific state in the field "orders.status". Example: pending

post.description: `it is important that the` **`identifier`** `is stored by the consumer, since it is required in cancellations`

post.summary: Create or retrieve an arrival order document
post.description: When you generate an arrival order, you need to print the "receipt" document and paste it on the product container

patch.description: The order may be canceled when it is not being processed or is already closed

example.message: The order <your identifier> is already cancelled
The order <your identifier> cannot be canceled, it is in in_progress status

get.description:
The following fields return in the responseBody the possible values by which the search can be filtered.

In case you want to clean the search, they should not be sent in the request.

### FIELDS

**search** 
    * It is used when you want to find a text within the values of the fields: "orders.orderNumber" or "orders.internalKey".
    
**filters[fulfillmentStatus][]**
    *   It is used when you want to find a specific state in the field "orders.fulfillmentStatus".
    *   Example: pending
    
**filters[deliveryType][]**
    *   It is used when you want to find a specific value in the field "orders.deliveryType".
    *   Example: SMD

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: It is used when you want to find a text within the values of the fields: "orders.orderNumber" or "orders.internalKey".

parameters.name: filters[fulfillmentStatus][]
parameters.description: It is used when you want to find a specific state in the field "orders.fulfillmentStatus". Example: pending

parameters.name: filters[deliveryType][]
parameters.description: It is used when you want to find a specific value in the field "orders.deliveryType". Example: SMD

origin.address: Av. del Taller 451, Jard√≠n Balbuena, √Ålvaro Obreg√≥n, 15900 Ciudad de M√©xico, CDMX, M√©xico

destination.address: Av 9 Pte 308, Centro hist√≥rico de Puebla, Puebla, Pue., M√©xico

options.notes: **Information to be printed on the label**

shipments.description:
Array of shipments that belong to the order.

Each shipment can contain the following params:

internalKey.description:
Unique shipment identifier. You can use this field to store your unique identifier of the shipment. All of our tracking systems support searching by internalKey. We strongly suggest you always use this field and make sure it is unique.

If its not given we will assign an ID for this field.


- maxLength: 36
- minLength: 5
    - example: 123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426655440000

firstName.description: Name of the person that recieves the shipment. example: Juan

lastName.description: Last Name of the person that recieves the shipment. example: Gonzales

phone.description: Phone of the person that recieves the shipment. Must include the international code.+573192000000

email.description: Email of the person that recieves

recipient.description: Person who will receive the shipment. You must specify the following fields:

firstName.description: Name of the person that recieves the shipment

lastName.description: Last Name of the person that recieves the shipment

phone.description: Phone of the person that recieves the shipment. Must include the international code

email.description: Email of the person that recieves

origin.description: Location where the package is picked up. Depending on the flow you choose, you must send different parameters. For more details go to the `Location Schema` section. If it is not given the default will be the warehouse address

destination.description: Location where a shipment is dropped off. Same as origin, see the `Location Schema` section for more details.

payments.description: Payment options are included in this section

paymentMethod.description:
Payment Method of the shipment. Be careful submitting allowed values.
Allowed values: [ 'cash', 'monthly', 'prepaid']

cashOnDelivery.description: Cash on delivery (COD) applies to shipments paid by the recipient in cash at the time of delivery. If it is not sent in the payload, it is assumed that this does not happen, otherwise the following fields must be included :

currency.description:
Be careful submitting allowed values.
 Allowed values: [ COP, MXN, CLP, PEN, ARP ]

InsuredValue.description: Amount in local currency for which the shipment will be insured. The shipment will be insured in case of damage, loss, theft. Extra fees could be applied, check with your support agent.

get.description:
Endpoint to get the order by orderId:

The output includes:

**id**: The order id  
**orderNumber** The order number  
**internalKey**: The internal key  
**fulfillmentStatus**: The fulfillment status  
**items**: Array of items includes the ***serialNumbers***  
and the ***tracking*** numbers

*   `The serialNumbers field will be displayed only if the field "fulfillmentStatus": "fulfilled"`
    

EndFragment
